titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Eugenio Cortez Collection, 1893-1900, 1914-1918 and undated

profiledesc.creation: August 5, 2011Encoded in XMetal Author by Nikki Lynn Thomas according to instructions in TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Eugenio Cortez Collection
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Spanish.

extref.corpname: The University of Texas at San Antonio Libraries Special Collections.

did.abstract: The Cortez family moved from San Diego, Texas to San Antonio, Texas.
The collection consists of 30 photographs documenting landmarks in San Diego, TX and San Antonio, TX as well as Eugenio Cortez's family members.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Cortez family moved from San Diego, Texas to San Antonio, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 30 photographs documenting landmarks in San Diego, TX and San Antonio, TX as well as Eugenio Cortez's family members.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is housed at UTSA's Main Campus and must be accessed via the John Peace Library Special Collections reading room. To request access, please use the Collections Request Form.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Eugenio Cortez at the date of accessioning.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection encoded by Nikki Lynn Thomas, Manuscripts Curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Eugenio Cortez collection, MS 356, University of Texas at San Antonio Libraries Special Collections.
